items.title: Amazon’s popular Blink Mini 2 smart cam just dropped to $18 all-time low, 2-pack down at $28 (Up to 60% off)
items.summary:
We are now tracking a deal at Amazon that drops its ultra-affordable Blink Mini 2 smart camera down to $17.99 with free shipping for Prime members or in orders over $35. This is regularly a $40 unit, which is now seeing a straight-up $22 markdown. Today’s 55% discount lands it $2 below its previous all-time low and our mention from last month when it hit $20 as part of Amazon’s early Prime Big Deal Day sale. The entire Blink Mini 2 lineup, which includes both 2- and 3-pack along with the outdoor adapter, has hit a new all-time low today, so be sure to grab them. While the newer Blink Mini 2K+ offers sharper 2K resolution, the current discount on the original Blink Mini 2 makes it an easy recommendation. Head below for more details.

more…

items.title: Score the new Xbox gaming handhelds at their best prices ever, now from $535 (Open-box “Excellent” w/ 1-yr. warranty)
items.summary:
Update: Best Buy now has an open-box unit of the new Xbox Ally X gaming handheld in “Excellent” condition for $949.99 shipped. That’s $50 less than its full $1,000 price and the best we’ve tracked so far. The standard Xbox ROG Ally model also available at $534.99 shipped. More details in the original post below.

If you don’t want to pay the full $600 price for a new Xbox Ally gaming handheld, Best Buy has an open box “Excellent” unit for $534.99 shipped. That’s $65 off its usual going rate, and the best price we’ve tracked for it to date. It hasn’t even been a full week since this particular handheld started shipping, so this unit is likely barely used and is hence marked to be in “like new” condition. The brand-new model, meanwhile, still sells at full price. Details below.

more…

Through its official Amazon storefront, folks can jump on the brand’s unique Home 3000 Portable Power Station that features a built-in AI voice assistant at $1,659 shipped, after clipping the on-page $400 off coupon. Carrying a $2,059 full price since hitting Amazon in early August, we spotted this same deal for the first time on the last day of September, having only dropped to $1,689 before that. The $400 markdown has been sticking around in the weeks since, providing you with extended time to score your own at the best price we have tracked since its release back in April.

I hate cables, but love technology, so I have to deal with them. This love/hate relationship has me always on the lookout for ways I can creatively hide and manage cords throughout my home. This 8-pack of spring-loaded clips can certainly help for $7.

items.title: Aventon takes up to $400 off new e-bikes: Security-packed Pace 4 smart cruiser at new $1,599 low (Reg. $1,799)
items.summary:
Aventon has launched an Early Access to Black Friday Sale with up to $400 discounts across its lineup of e-bikes – including some first-time discounts and new lows hitting the brand’s most recent models. Among the lineup of new models seeing discounts, we spotted the Pace 4 Smart Step-Through Cruiser e-bike dropping to $1,599 shipped. This is one of the newest rides under the brand’s flag that has been on the market since April with a $1,799 full price, only having seen two previous discounts in the time since to $1,699. Now, during this early-access sale, you can get $200 off the going rate for the all-time lowest price we have tracked anywhere. Head below to check out the full lineup of deals.

items.title: Criterion’s entire stock of Blu-rays are half off for a very limited time
items.summary: Criterion recently kicked off its semi-annual sale that slashes the cost of all of its in-stock Blu-rays, DVDs, and box sets. The sale will last through 12PM ET, October 23rd. This a great opportunity to save on deep cuts that aren’t typically discounted. However, it likely won’t be the last chance to get a deal […]

items.title: OpenAI requested memorial attendee list in ChatGPT suicide lawsuit
items.summary: The new information comes as the Raines family updated its lawsuit against OpenAI. The family first filed a wrongful death suit against OpenAI in August after alleging their son had taken his own life following conversations with the chatbot about his mental health and suicidal ideation.

items.title: Anker brings back Prime pricing on its SOLIX F3800 Plus power station starting from a $2,599 low (Reg. up to $4,799), more
items.summary:
As part of Anker’s ongoing SOLIX Halloween Sale, we’re seeing some great discounts on the brand’s SOLIX F3800 Plus Portable Power Station and its bundles, with the standalone unit and a FREE protective cover (valued at $159) starting at $2,599 shipped, after using the promo code SOLIXHAW01 at checkout for an additional $100 off, beating out Amazon’s pricing by $130. It carries a $4,799 MSRP directly from the brand, but more often can be scored down around the $3,899 when at full price at Amazon. Discounts over the year have mostly dropped costs further to $2,799, with some occasional dips lower to $2,699 and $2,599, the latter of which was only seen a few weeks ago during the Prime Day event. You’re looking at another chance to pick it up at its Prime Day low, saving you $1,300 off the going rate and $2,200 off the MSRP for the best price we have tracked. Head below to check out the full lineup of deals for this model.

more…

items.title: Apple confirms it pulled controversial dating apps Tea and TeaOnHer from the App Store
items.summary: Apple has pulled the controversial dating safety apps Tea and TeaOnHer from the App Store over violations of its content moderation and privacy rules, following a flood of user complaints and reports of minors’ data being exposed.

items.title: Instagram rolls out custom icons … but only for teens
items.summary: Instagram introduced custom app icons for its teen accounts, but not everyone is thrilled. In replies to the company’s post on X, users criticized the feature for being age-gated, arguing that adults like personalization, too.

items.title: GM is bringing Google Gemini-powered AI assistant to cars in 2026
items.summary: GM is the latest automaker to lean into generative AI-based assistants that promise to respond to driver requests in a more natural-sounding way. Stellantis is collaborating with French AI firm Mistral, Mercedes is integrating ChatGPT, and Tesla has brought xAI’s Grok to its vehicles.
